newsitem.title: USA: Avery Dennison Q3 shr at $0.89 - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Avery Dennison Q3 shr at $0.89 - WSJ.

text.p: Avery Dennison Corp plans to report record third-quarter profit and sales as well as recommend a stock split and dividend increase on Tuesday, the Wall Street Journal reported.

The newspaper said the labeling company's chief financial officer, Gregory Jenkins, said in an interview that Avery will report a net income for the quarter totalling $46.6 million or $0.89 per share.
Jenkins said the company's quarterly operating profit was 7.5 percent higher than analyst expectations.

Operating profit totalled $0.86 per share against analyst estimates of $0.80 when excluding a one-time gain of $0.03 a share from the sale of a joint venture interest in Japan, he was quoted as saying.
The newspaper said the company's net income was 30 percent higher than the $35.8 million or $0.67 per share reported for the same period last year.
Profit before interest, taxes and one-time gains reached 9.7 percent in the latest quarter or a full percentage point higher than a year earlier, it said.
Avery's sales for the quarter were $819.3 million, 5.0 percent more than last year's $783.5 million, it added.
The newspaper cited Jenkins as saying the healthy quarterly results were due to the strongest operating margins in nearly 10 years.
"The restructuring work that we have been doing for four years now is finally cutting in," he said.
The newspaper also said the company planned to recommend a stock split and an effective dividend increase to the company's board of directors, which is to meet on Thursday.
Avery made a two-for-one split in March 1987, it said, adding that its current quarterly dividend was $0.30 a share.
